title: Can floating turbines harvest the world's wind?
description: Our climate editor checks out the world's largest floating wind farm off the coast of Scotland.

title: Lyon 1-5 Arsenal: A special night for Gunners as they humble Champions League holders
description: Arsenal's 5-1 win over Champions League holders Lyon is seen as a result that could "shift the whole balance of the women's game".

title: Teachers join Jamie Oliver free school meals call
description: Pressure builds on the government as a campaign to expand eligibility for free school meals grows.

title: Malorie Blackman calls for year-round black history in schools
description: The Noughts and Crosses author says schools should teach "whole-truth" black history all year round.

title: Suella Braverman quits and vote chaos add to turmoil for the PM
description: The resignation of a senior minister and anger over a vote on fracking pile even more pressure on the prime minister.

title: Black Death 700 years ago affects your health now
description: Mutations that saved lives from the plague are causing auto-immune diseases today.

title: Chris Mason: So what are the PM's options now?
description: One senior Tory MP said Liz Truss' actions have been "unforgivable," "terrible" and "appalling".

title: US reminds pro-Putin Hungary it's a Western ally
description: The US embassy hits back at anti-American remarks from Viktor Orban's government over the Ukraine war.

title: India's virtual stars whose real faces you won't see
description: 'Virtual YouTubers' or VTubers use quirky digital avatars to mask their identities online.

title: General practice is like calling an Uber, MPs say
description: A cross-party group says patients are receiving an unacceptably poor service amid a shortage of GPs.

title: Midnights: What we know about Taylor Swift's songwriting

title: Ethiopia's Tigray conflict: Nasa shows how a war zone faded from space
description: Images of nights skies show power supplies disappearing in Ethiopia as a humanitarian crisis bites.

title: Ukrainians told to 'charge everything' as power grid hit by Russia
description: Ukraine's grid operator warns of many power cuts after Russian missiles damaged energy facilities.

title: Plan to ensure some services run during strikes
description: Unions say the government's plan, which follows months of industrial action, is "doomed".

title: People plan for smaller Christmas as prices soar
description: Inflation returned to a 40-year high in September as a BBC survey suggests people are cutting spending.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How 'front-foot' Bruno Fernandes was back to his Man Utd best
description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker & Micah Richards discuss how Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes was back to his best in their 2-0 victory over Tottenham in the Premier League.

title: The Papers: 'Truss on the brink' and 'chaos' of Braverman exit
description: Suella Braverman's resignation during a chaotic day at Westminster leads most of the papers.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Erik ten Hag will 'deal with' Man Utd forward over early exit down tunnel
description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says he will "deal with" Cristiano Ronaldo after the unused substitute walked down the tunnel before the end of the win over Tottenham.

title: Ukrainian troops under close gunfire

title: Newcastle United 1-0 Everton: Miguel Almiron strike sees Magpies underline top-six credentials
description: Newcastle underline their top-six credentials by beating Everton thanks to Miguel Almiron's fifth goal of the season.

description: Arsenal put in a phenomenal performance to beat Women's Champions League holders Lyon with goals from Caitlin Foord, Frida Maanum and Beth Mead.

description: Manchester United produce arguably their finest performance under manager Erik ten Hag as Tottenham are swept aside at Old Trafford.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Wales 12-18 Cook Islands - Steve Marsters seals Kukis' victory
description: Cook Islands power back from a half-time deficit to edge Wales in their Rugby League World Cup opener in Leigh.

description: Darwin Nunez scores his first Anfield goal for Liverpool and Alisson saves a penalty as the Reds defeat West Ham in an incident-packed encounter.

title: WATCH: 'I've had enough of talentless people' - Charles Walker
description: The veteran politician spoke candidly with the BBC about his frustrations with the government.

title: Rory McIlroy: World number two rejects Phil Mickelson 'winning side' comments on LIV
description: Rory McIlroy rejects Phil Mickelson's suggestion that he has picked the "winning side" in the dispute between the LIV series and PGA Tour.

title: LS Lowry's Going To The Match sells for £7.8m at auction
description: The sale of the artwork, described as an "iconic masterpiece", means it will remain on public display.

description: Thousands of civilians and officials will be moved in Kherson region because of Ukraine's offensive.

description: England bowler Reece Topley is set to be ruled out of the T20 World Cup with an ankle injury, three days before his side's tournament opener on Saturday.

description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he would "hate it" if his comments about Manchester City's spending power were seen as xenophobic.

title: Race hate crimes: Victim of nightclub attacks calls for harsher punishments
description: Ebehitale Igene was attacked three times in a nightclub, with footage posted on social media.

title: HSBC climate change adverts banned by UK watchdog
